Posts.Content: Hi, Just wanted to send hugs and best wishes. This site is great for info and having a rant when you feel low or when you are having a bad day. If I'm low I just post it on here and someone always replies and you feel much better. xx
Posts.Title: The waiting game!

Posts.Content: Hi, Woke up this morning still in pain from infection from mastectomy and thought bugger it I am going to have a happy day today. I'm fed up hurting and feeling sorry for myself, so today I'm going to shove this cancer thing to the back of my mind, have a bath sort of, hubby cooking fry up, go for a walk later and then slob on the sofa all afternoon and tomorrow is another day. Happy Sunday xxx
Posts.Title: Happy Sunday.

Posts.Content: Hannah Love your plan.xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine, LOL, brilliant message, thanks.xxxx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I am sooo glad that I have you ladies to rant to, a lovely 'friend' asked me tonight how I am feeling and I replied that I was a lot better and was explaining that I am waiting on an mri scan because of problems with my back and that I have a 'racy heart' as the doctor put it.' Friend then said 'Don't you think you are milking it just because you have had cancer' I had to walk away so she did not notice that my eyes filled up. Maybe I am over reacting to any aches and pains, as now I am starting to question myself. I just feel so upset that anyone could think like that. I have always been a strong and independent woman and not shy about giving out my opinion  (even though I am only 5 foot tall and only weight seven and a half stone)and she reduced me to tears. Is this what this bloody cancer has done to me. xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Maxinem2 Thank you, I really wish I could of thought of just one of them comments at the time I would have felt so much better. As you say though hours after.  Danielle
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Anne, I think your 'friend and mine' should be best buddies, they seem to have the same mentality. I prefer the friends that I have on this site.xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Hi all, So hearten by all your posts, some really made me lol and some made me cry but happy tears. Who needs other 'friends' when I have you ladies watching my back. HUGS FOR ALL.xxx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Carolyn, Looking at your post through my pathetic tears over a friend who isn't worth it really made me laugh. Love it, thanks for making me smile.xx
Posts.Title: Really bloody angry !!!

Posts.Content: Carolyn, I love your pandas that pop up, they so cute and cuddly. I now want a pocket size one to carry around. When this crappy time fades into the background a little, the main thing I will remember Im sure is the pandas. xx
Posts.Title: Pandas

Posts.Content: Hi, Just wanted to send you massive hugs to help you and your husband to get through these scary times. xxxxx
Posts.Title: Decisions to make, all so overwhelming

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Just popped in for a chat and see what everyone is up to today. Had mastectomy Saturday so just recovering and chilling out. Finding it hard not to do anything around the house, I work full time usually and am always on the go but as now I feel quite weak and know i should be resting I'm looking for things to do. So this is why I'm posting this to make me sit down. What do others do to make them sit down and take it easy, I keep getting light headed because  I'm trying to run before I can walk. xx
Posts.Title: just chatting

Posts.Content: Hi Bothered, I think this is down to personal choice, there has been loads of times and still is that I have seriously thought about not taking the tablets, but always end up stressed about it and leave it for another day. I hate the way I feel, aching joints, always tired, hot flushes and bloody moody. Some days I think that I have to do everything to help prevent a reoccurrence and other days I just to feel 'normal' and back to my happy self. It's so hard sometimes. xx
Posts.Title: Side effects of medication

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite Box sets, I never thought of them, Im going to look now. A book that I have looked really good so I started that and the first chapter was about a woman's friend who had breast cancer so I skipped the book. I am finding that I now notice all the adverts on telly and magazines that concern cancer, there seem to be so many of them or is it that I just didn't take any notice before. Windows need cleaning but as I hate that job I can ignore them and not feel guilty.
Posts.Title: just chatting

Posts.Content: Hi scared66 I think that anyone who has to put up with all the things that we have to go through is entitled to be emotional wrecks. I am always tired, when I get up and when I go to bed. Don't be sorry for having a ramble, it's all normal and it makes you feel better.
Posts.Title: Just wondering if I'm normal

Posts.Content: Hi star67, This is the best place to ask all your questions, there is always someone to help. I have had a lumpectomy one side and mastectomy the other, but lumpectomy last year and mastectomy this year. The lumpectomy left me with a large dent due to the amount of tissue they removed but as I was small anyway I wasn't too fussed. But I didn't opt for reconstruction even after mastectomy as I wanted the least amount of recovery time, but everyone is different . Take your time making your decision as you will find at first you will keep changing your mind. Lots of hugs. xx
Posts.Title: Double masectomy or masectomy and lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Thinking back on what the consultant told me when I had my results back from biopsies, She said it was positive but also said it was not the usual kind of cancer that you got in your breast and as my brain didn't seem to take much in I didn't ask what type it was. I am waiting on a letter explaining everything and hopefully that will tell me. But has anyone else had this, not a normal type? I wish I could have listened more intently instead of my brain going with the fairies. Now I have remembered this I starting to stress again and looking up types of cancer, not a sensible thing to do. All this stressing though is not doing me any good, I am 5ft and seven an half stone and lose weight so quickly, I have always been skinny but worried I might slip down a drain or plughole if I don't stop worrying. Any cake donations appreciated, I cant cook    :)
Posts.Title: What type of breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Grogg I have rang the BCN and they are phoning me back in the morning, I am due to have an MRI scan in two weeks and a mastectomy in April. They aren't sure about chemo yet. It's the waiting that I hate, finding it hard to cope this time around. Reading though all the posts here really help though as I am finding it hard to talk to people who are close to me as I don't want to worry them. Shame about the cake situation though.
Posts.Title: What type of breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Blanket and all the other posts, I have spoken to bcn, who was so helpful and understanding, and she explained  that I have lobular cancer without lymph node movement, It is 2cm which she said is not that big. I have pushed for a double mastectomy and she seemed very hopeful. I have appointment with the consultant again on Thursday as I have turned down reconstruction so will not need MRI, so hopefully I can have op sooner than 3 weeks time. Tomorrow would be good "!! Blanket, can I opt for lemon drizzle cake.
Posts.Title: What type of breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Maggs I didn't know that you get a genetics test, what exactly is it and how do they do it ? Sorry if this sounds a daft thing to ask but I have never heard of it.
Posts.Title: Increaseed risk of cancer in other breast -why?

Posts.Content: Hi, I wish I knew why the risk is increased as I had DCIS last year in my right breast and treated successfully. A few weeks ago, not long before my first annual check up I found a large lump in my left breast and now have to have to have a mastectomy in March. It seems so unfair.. I am now totally stressed out and worrying myself stupid. Sorry to rant on but I just needed to let that out. x
Posts.Title: Increaseed risk of cancer in other breast -why?

Posts.Content: Hi Anne, I hope you do go on your holiday as you will be either worrying about your first mammogram or the results, but worrying anyway. At least you will be able to worry either way on a sunny beach and give yourself time to get your thoughts into gear. My brain seems to have turned to mush at the moment, a  good excuse for not doing anything around the house. After reading the other posts I feel better about my own situation, you sometimes forget other people are in the same place or worse and makes you realise things do get easier. Waiting for my mastectomy is the worst part. Hugs to everyone.
Posts.Title: Increaseed risk of cancer in other breast -why?

Posts.Content: Hi Toxophilite You sound like you are having a really crap day, Im not feeling too good either but I am willing to share my chocolate buttons with you. Sending you a massive hug.xxx
Posts.Title: What today was like.....

Posts.Content: That's good news LondonLass. xx
Posts.Title: STABLE.........
